ygData.msgSnippet: At the outset, IMO, you should decide whether or not you want the machine to learn on its own to play TTT. With or without a model, that is the question!  IF

Subject: Re: [neat] Applying NEAT to Tic-Tac-Toe
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=104426122
X-Yahoo-Profile: zenguyuno

At the outset, IMO, you should decide whether or not
you want the machine to learn on its own to play TTT. 
With or without a model, that is the question!  IF you
create a perfect TTT player and use it as a model,
then you should be able to evolve ANNs that
re-recreate that behaviour.  OTOH, you may be able to
succeed without any model, by basing evolution on
success in a tournament of some kind.  If you succeed
with this approach you will have accomplished
something significant, because TTT has not previously
been solved this way, at least not to the point of
evolving a perfect player of the game.  If you choose
this path you want to make sure that the machine is
not programmed with any strategy knowledge whatsoever.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
